Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2008 03:35PM sallyk wrote: Hi Davebobbie and Binney, Thanks for the input. Binney you have alot of knowledge on LE. I'm going to drive the 60 miles and see the LE therapist. There is one about 15 miles closer but she is private and don't know if insurance will pay.My doctor has already sent paper work. I can not wrap at work. We are union they will say if you can't do your job take medical leave. There is no ac in the summer and it gets very hot so I might do the medical leave. What will a good LE therapist do? The last one did some measurments and showed me how to massage and wrap. She did not touch my arm at all during massage. I watch her do her own then I had to do mine. Does that sound right? I will try the bike shirt  and see if that helps. I also have a glove but it is too tight. I had a root canal done today. The dentist put me on amoxil he does not want to take a chance with infection. Thanks Sallyk
Posts.Title: Should I try a new LE therapist ? sallyk inspiewriter

Posts.Content: sallyk wrote: Hi, Has anyone had underarm peeling? It is on the same side as surgery for node and had rads. Finished rad in 2006 so this is something new going on.  I use Toms deo and have for a long time. Just wondering if anyone else had to deal with this and what to do.  Sallyk Dx 7/28/2005, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 33/40 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 10/2012, IDC, Stage IV, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: underarm peeling sallyk Ting11

Posts.Content: sallyk wrote: I have swelling and pain from across the top of my hand to my wrist, to one of my fingers, and my arm. I went to a therapist couple times, but she is not LE qualified but deals with LE. She showed me how to massage my arm and fitted me with a glove and sleeve. Also she showed me how to wrap my arm, but I can not wear the wrap at work. The sleeve is so tight now that it leaves indents in my arm and hand when I take it off. She said if I need anything else call her. I have not had to wear it for a year. I woke last week and the hand was swelled and hurting.  I thought I broke it but that is not the case. There is only three qualified LE therapist in Indiana that I can find. I will have to travel about 60 miles to see one. Do you think I should? Also how many times does a qualified LE therapist have you to come back?  Thank you! Sallyk Dx 7/28/2005, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 33/40 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 10/2012, IDC, Stage IV, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2007 03:49PM sallyk wrote: Erika, I did have my nodes removed. Had chemo, surgery and rads. They did the SNB during surgery all 3 were postive so all nodes(44) were removed the same time the tumor was removed. The problems with some of us sisters  is the chemo did not do the job. Or should I say the job we had hope for. But I'm not giving up. I expect to be NED forever. Did you have a port in? I have swelling also but it is were my port line was in the vein. Sallyk
Posts.Title: Positive nodes after chemo and surgery nbare1952 Annaanne

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2007 07:26PM sallyk wrote: Hi Debbie, I had chemo before surgery. My tumor was 2.7cm. I had 8 rounds of chemo then the surgery. At the time of surgery it was 1.7cm. I have spoke to alot of ladies that had a great  response to the chemo. Right now everything will seem so overwhelming but with time it does get better. Try to surround yourself with postive friends. There are alot of helpful ladies on here that will help you with your journey. It will be a long ride but in the end you will be a survivor. Take Care, SallyK
Posts.Title: Chemo before Surgery Large Tumor jengrsq shrink

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2013 06:54PM sallyk wrote: Hi Blondie, I have ducal that has spread to the omentum and peritoneum. My doctor said this is very rare. In Oct. I was given 3 rounds of chemo. Did not have a good response so was switched to Falseodex and Fermara. Went from having fluid drained from the stomach every 2 weeks and feeling terrible to feeling great. Doctor said this will probably work for awhile then we can more on to another treatment. I have a lot of faith and believing in a miracle. Oh also was told I was not a candidate for debulking.

White cell count has been low since chemo. I'm taking arimidex.

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2007 10:26PM sallyk wrote: Erika, I blame alot on chemo that is the only good thing about it. It's starting to get old around here. They took all the nodes out when they removed the bc and sent them to the lab. My dr. called 3 days  after surgery and told me he got clean margins but I had 33 nodes with cancer in them. I'm doing great now. Yes it could be soft tissue but ask for xray or ct scan if it will make you feel better. Do you get scared when it is time for your check up? I know I do. My dr checks it out  so I will have some peace. What is your dx? Sallyk
